content:
I think I'll definitely give both podcasts a try, especially "Cognitive Psychology" since it seems to align more closely with my interests. I've been enjoying learning about cognitive biases and heuristics, and I think this podcast will provide more in-depth information on those topics. Radiolab also sounds interesting, and I like the idea of exploring a wider range of topics beyond just psychology.

By the way, have you come across any other resources or books that might be helpful for someone looking to improve their critical thinking skills? I've been trying to be more mindful of my own biases and assumptions, and I'm looking for ways to improve my critical thinking abilities.
